intro: Freycinetia distigmata, commonly known as the broad-leafed screw pine, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries. It thrives in coastal and wetland environments, often growing in dense stands. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
